meanings.sent1: The lyophilic substance easily mixed with the water.
meanings.sent2: The sugar was lyophilic and dissolved quickly in the tea.
meanings.sent3: The lyophilic paint seemed to hug the canvas as it spread smoothly.
meanings.sent4: Her welcoming smile was as lyophilic as a magnet to liquid.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's playful nature was lyophilic, drawing everyone in with its charm.

meanings.definition: Tending to dissolve in or mix with liquids.
meanings.sent1: The lyophilic powder dissolved instantly in the milk.
meanings.sent2: The ink was lyophilic, spreading easily on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The lyophilic soap bubbled up in the sink, eager to clean.
meanings.sent4: His words were as lyophilic as sugar in hot coffee, melting her defenses.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh bread was so lyophilic, it filled the entire room with warmth.
